Package runner

Class WeatherScatterPlot

java.lang.Object
org.jzy3d.analysis.AbstractAnalysis
runner.ScatterPlot
runner.WeatherScatterPlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.jzy3d.analysis.IAnalysis
Direct Known Subclasses:
GridWeatherScatterPlotRunner, WeatherStationsScatterPlotRunner
public abstract class WeatherScatterPlot
extends ScatterPlot
A ScatterPlot displaying a set of points in 3d space. The 3d model can than be viewed from different angles to allow for a good visualization of the structure of the plotted data.

The points to be plotted are the result of embedding GeographicPolygons. The color of resulting points is generated using different WeatherPolygonPainters. This class also allows to periodically toggle the coloring scheme.

Every implementation of this class must implement a method getDataFactory(Map) providing the GeographicPolygon dataset as well as getEmbedder(Polygon[]) to construct an Embedder used to map the Polygons to points.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Constructor Details

    • WeatherScatterPlot

      protected WeatherScatterPlot​(float pointSize)
      Constructs a new WeatherScatterPlot object using the given point size.
      Parameters:
      pointSize - the size of plotted points in pixels. The points will be drawn as squares with this value as their side length.

  • Method Details

    • animateColor

      public void animateColor​(int delay)
      Start to cycle through different coloring schemes. This method will not terminate! The duration every coloring scheme can be chosen.
      Parameters:
      delay - the duration every coloring scheme is used before the next switch

    • setDataFilter

      public void setDataFilter​(java.util.function.Predicate<double[]> filter)
      Sets the data filter. To disable the filter call this method with null as parameter. The filter is used to decide whether to keep a GeographicPolygon in the dataset or not
      Parameters:
      filter - the filter to decide whether to keep a GeographicPolygon or not

    • generateDataset

      protected void generateDataset()
      Generates and saves the dataset to be embedded using the WeatherDataPolygonsFactory provided by any implementation of this class. If a filter is defined, it will be used to potentially thin out the data set.

    • getDataFactory

      protected abstract WeatherDataPolygonsFactory getDataFactory​(java.util.Map<WeatherFeature,​java.lang.Double> features)
      Constructs a factory for GeographicPolygons using the given weighted WeatherFeatures.
      Parameters:
      features - the weighted WeatherFeatures present in the generated GeographicPolygons.
      Returns:
      the WeatherDataPolygonsFactory used to generate the dataset to be embedded

    • getDefaultFeatureMap

      protected java.util.Map<WeatherFeature,​java.lang.Double> getDefaultFeatureMap()
      Generates and returns the weighted features used for the Polygon construction.
      Returns:
      the default map of weighted WeatherFeatures

    • getDefaultStartTime

      protected java.util.Calendar getDefaultStartTime()
      Generates and returns the start time of the time window used for the Polygon construction.
      Returns:
      the default start time

    • getEmbedder

      protected abstract Embedder<Polygon> getEmbedder​(Polygon[] polygons)
      Returns an Embedder used to map the Polygons to points. These points can than be plotted in 3d.
      Parameters:
      polygons - the Polygons to construct an Embedder for
      Returns:
      the constructed Embedder

    • getPoints

      protected java.util.List<org.jzy3d.plot3d.primitives.LightPoint> getPoints()
      Returns the set of LightPoints to be plotted. Every LightPoint corresponds to a GeographicPolygon embedded in 3d space. The color of these points is not dependent on their embedding position but on meta data of the corrsponding Polygon.
      Specified by:
      getPoints in class ScatterPlot
      Returns:
      the list of colored points to be plotted

    • getColors

      private org.jzy3d.colors.Color[] getColors​(GeographicPolygon[] polygons)
      Returns the colors of each GeographicPolygon in the dataset. These colors are used to color the points resulting from embedding these.
      Parameters:
      polygons - the Polygons
      Returns:
      the colors corresponding to the given Polygons
